content:
Dear all,

@Riccardo Brasca  and myself have funding for a PhD position starting in Autumn 2026:

  • it is a PhD specifically in formalisation. We are looking for someone interested in arithmetic geometry and number theory: two options would be to work either on Tate thesis or on non-archimedean functional analysis and arithmetic applications, but other options can be discussed;
  • the candidate will be based in Saint-Étienne (whose Math department is joint with Lyon, which is very close and where the formalisation community is quite active), and will be expected to travel to Paris on a regular basis;
  • it's a 3 years fellowship without teaching. Most likely there is the possibility of a fourth year extension, with teaching in the fourth year.
  • Speaking French is not required, but France it's France, and for everyday life it's a good idea to learn some French at some moment.

To apply, please send your CV and a motivation letter at filippo.nuccio@univ-st-etienne.fr and riccardo.brasca@gmail.com

We expect applications to arrive by January 31st and to select our candidates by February 15th.

Riccardo and Filippo
Is there a link to a job ad?
No, there is no official "job ad": this is part of a fellowship we obtained and we're thus entitled to pick our candidate without any official "opening" at our universities.
Let me remind here that with @Riccardo Brasca we're accepting candidatures for the PhD position advertised above, and that the deadline is approaching.
